Package com.larashores.laraspipes.utils

Class ItemTypeSlot

java.lang.Object
net.minecraft.world.inventory.Slot
net.minecraftforge.items.SlotItemHandler
com.larashores.laraspipes.utils.ItemTypeSlot
public class ItemTypeSlot extends net.minecraftforge.items.SlotItemHandler
SlotItemHandler that is used to specify a type of item rather than store items. When a player tries to store an ItemStack in the slot, a single copy of the item will be added to the ItemStack instead. When a player tries to remove an item from the slot, the slot will be cleared instead of removed.

    • ItemTypeSlot

      public ItemTypeSlot(net.minecraftforge.items.IItemHandler handler, int index, int xPosition, int yPosition)
      Creates the ItemTypeSlot.
      Parameters:
      handler - Handler to run whenever the contents of the slot have changed.
      index - Index of the slot within a group of slots.
      xPosition - x pixel position of the slot within a screen.
      yPosition - y pixel position of the slot within a screen.

  • Method Details

    • safeInsert

      @NotNull public @NotNull net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack safeInsert(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack, int count)
      Triggered when a player clicks on the slot with an ItemStack. Sets the item type of the slot.
      Overrides:
      safeInsert in class net.minecraft.world.inventory.Slot
      Parameters:
      stack - ItemStack the player clicked on.
      count - Number of items the player wants to add to the slot (this will always be ignored).
      Returns:
      The same stack that was clicked with, signalling that no items were removed from it.

    • tryRemove

      @NotNull public @NotNull Optional<net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack> tryRemove(int amount, int min, net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player)
      Triggered when a player tries to remove an item from the slot. Clears the slot without removing any items.
      Overrides:
      tryRemove in class net.minecraft.world.inventory.Slot
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount of the item the player wants to remove.
      min - The minimum amount of item the player wants to remove.
      player - The player attempting to remove items.
      Returns:
      An empty item stack, signaling that nothing could be removed.
